privacyParagraphOne: Flitaa   respects and protects the privacy   of   visitors   to   our   websites   and   our customers   who   use   our   services.   To   ensure   transparency,   this   Privacy   Policy describes our information handling practises when you access content we own or operate on the websites or any other platforms we own or operate (collectively, the Site(s)) and related services (referred to collectively hereinafter as Services).
privacyParagraphTwo: Please take a moment to read this Privacy Policy carefully. If you have any questions about this Privacy Notice, please contact us at privacy@flitaa.com
privacyParagraphThree: By   accessing   and   using   our   Services,   you   signify   acceptance   of   the   terms   of   thisPrivacy Policy. Where we require your consent to process your personal information, we will ask for your consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information   as   described   further   below.   If   you   do   not   agree   with   or   are   not comfortable   with   any   aspect   of   this   Privacy   Policy,   you   should   immediately discontinue access to or use of our Services.
privacyParagraphFour: We   reserve   the   right   to   modify   this   Privacy   Policy   at   any   time   without   prior notification.
privacyPersonalText: Personal information is data that can be used to identify you directly or indirectly, or to   contact   you.   Our   Privacy   Policy   covers   all   personal   information   that   you voluntarily submit to us and that we obtain from our partners. This Privacy Policy does not apply to anonymised data, as it cannot be used to identify you. You may be asked to provide personal information anytime you are in contact with Flitaa. Except as described in this Privacy Policy, Flitaa will not give, sell, rent or loan any personal information to any third party without your consent
privacyParagraphSeven: We collect personal information to provide you with our Services. When we require certain personal information from users, it is because we are required by law to collect this information or because it is relevant for specific purposes. Any information you provide to us that is not required is voluntary. You are free to choose whether to provide us with the types of personal information requested, but we may not be able to serve you as effectively or offer you all of our Services when you do choose not to share certain information with us.
privacyParagraphEight: We collect the following types of information:
privacyParagraphNine: a.  Personal Identification Information: full name, date of birth, age, nationality, gender, signature, utility bills, photographs, phone number, home address, and/or email.
privacyParagraphTen: b.  Formal Identification Information: passport number, driver’s licence details, national identity card details, photograph identification cardsc  Financial Information: bank account information, payment card primary account number (PAN), transaction history, trading data.
privacyParagraphEleven: c.  Transaction Information: Information about the transactions you make on our Sites such as the name of the recipient, your name, the amount, and/or timestamp.
privacyParagraphTwelve: d.  Contact Data: includes billing addresses, delivery addresses, email addresses, telephone numbers and other information.
privacyParagraphThirteen: e.  Contacts’ list and Address Book Information: With your permission, we may access your contact list and phone book available on your mobile device in order to provide billing and airtime transaction services to you. We only use this information to process transactions for intended recipients and for no other purposes. We do not hold this information in any way or at any time.
privacyParagraphFourteen: f.  Employment Information: office location, job title, and/or description of the role.
privacyParagraphFifteen: g.  Online Identifiers and Location Data: Geo location/tracking details, browser fingerprint, OS, browser name and version, and/or personal IP addresses
privacyParagraphSixteen: h.  Marketing and Communications Data: includes your preferences for receiving marketing from us and our third parties and your communication preferences.
privacyParagraphSeventeen: i.  Usage Data: survey responses, information provided to our support team, public social networking posts, authentication data, security questions, user ID, click-stream data and other data collected via cookies and similar technologies. Please read our cookie policy for more information.
privacyParagraphEighteen: **Log and Usage Data. Log and usage data is service-related, diagnostic, usage and performance information our servers automatically collect when you access or use our Services and which we record in log files. Depending on how you interact with us, this log data may include your IP address, device information, browser type and settings and information about your activity in the Services (such as the date/time stamps associated with your usage, pages and files viewed, searches and other actions you take such as which features you use), device event information (such as system activity, error reports (sometimes called ‘crash dumps’) and hardware settings). **Device Data. We collect device data such as information about your computer, phone, tablet or other device you use to access the Services. Depending on the device used, this device data may include information such as your IP address (or proxy server), device and application identification numbers, location, browser type, hardware model Internet service provider and/or mobile carrier, operating system and system configuration information.
privacyParagraphNineteen: HOW YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION IS USED
privacyParagraphTwenty: Our primary purpose in collecting personal information is to provide you with a secure, smooth, efficient, and customised experience. In general, we use personal information to create, develop, operate, deliver, and improve our Services, content and advertising, as well as for loss prevention and anti-fraud purposes. We may use this information in the following ways:
privacyParagraphTwentyOne: A.  To verify your identity in accordance with Know Your Customer (KYC), Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and sanctions screening requirements;
privacyParagraphTwentyTwo: B.  To enforce our terms in our user agreement and other agreements to manage and maintain your account with us;
privacyParagraphTwentyThree: C.  To prevent fraudulent or unauthorised use of our products and services;
privacyParagraphTwentyFour: D.  To better manage our business and your relationship with us; to improve our products and services, and to develop new products and Services;
privacyParagraphTwentyFive: E.  To notify you about benefits and changes to the features of our products and services;
privacyParagraphTwentyFive1: F.  To provide you with personalised advertising and marketing;
privacyParagraphTwentyFive2: G.  To respond to your inquiries and to resolve disputes.
privacyParagraphTwentyFive3: H.  Where necessary to protect our legal rights and interests, or the interests of others, we also use personal data in relation to legal claims, compliance, audits, risk management and regulatory functions. We may also use personal data in connection with the acquisition, merger or sale of a business.
privacyParagraphTwentySeven: From time to time, we may obtain information about you from third party sources as required or permitted by applicable law, such as public databases, credit bureaus, ID verification partners, resellers and channel partners, joint marketing partners, and social media platforms.
privacyParagraphTwentyEight: COLLECTION AND USE OF INFORMATION COLLECTED AUTOMATICALLY
privacyParagraphTwentyNine: We receive and store certain types of information automatically, such as whenever you interact with the Sites or use the Services. This information does not necessarily reveal your identity directly but may include information about the specific device you are using, such as the hardware model, device ID, operating system version, web-browser software (such as Firefox, Safari, or Internet Explorer) and your Internet Protocol (IP) address/MAC address/device identifier. For example, we automatically receive and record information on our server logs from your browser, including how you came to and used the Services, your IP address, device type and unique device identification numbers, device event information (such as crashes, system activity and hardware settings), browser type, browser language, the date and time of your request and referral URL, broad geographic location (e.g., country or city-level location) and other technical data collected through cookies, pixel tags and other similar technologies that uniquely identify your browser. We may also collect information about how your device has interacted with our website, including pages accessed and links clicked. We may use identifiers to recognise you when you arrive at the Site via an external link, such as a link appearing on a third party site.
privacyParagraphThirty: HOW WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL DATA
privacyParagraphThirtyTwo: A. Any person who works for us or for one of our group companies;
privacyParagraphThirtyThree: B. Any entity that forms part of Flitaa, including, where relevant, the Flitaa operating entity in the country or region in which you live;
privacyParagraphThirtyFour: C. Financial and other institutions we partner with to provide our products and services; Companies and organisations that provide services to us, including in relation to technical infrastructure, marketing and analytics, and web and app development;
privacyParagraphThirtyFive: D. Companies and organisations that assist us with identity verification, background screening, due diligence and processing or otherwise fulfilling transactions that you have requested;
privacyParagraphThirtySix: E. Our professional advisers, consultants and other similar service providers.
privacyParagraphThirtySeven: F. Where we believe it is reasonably necessary to comply with any law, regulation, legal process or governmental request, to enforce our Terms of Use or other agreements, or to protect the rights, property, or safety of us, our customers or others;
privacyParagraphThirtyEight: G. Where we may transfer rights and obligations pursuant to our agreement with you.
privacyParagraphThirtyNine: HOW WE PROTECT AND STORE PERSONAL INFORMATION
privacyParagraphForty: We understand how important your privacy is, which is why Flitaa maintains (and requires its service providers to maintain) appropriate physical, technical and administrative safeguards to protect the security and confidentiality of the personal information you entrust to us.
privacyParagraphFortyOne: We may store and process all or part of your personal and transactional information, depending on where our facilities or service providers are located. We protect your personal information by maintaining physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards in compliance with the applicable laws and regulations.
privacyParagraphFortyTwo: For example, we use computer safeguards such as firewalls and data encryption; we enforce physical access controls on our buildings and files; and we authorise access to personal information only for those employees who require it to fulfil their job responsibilities. Full credit card data is securely transferred and hosted off-site by a payment vendor in compliance with Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI DSS). This information is not accessible to Flitaa or Flitaa staff.
privacyParagraphFortyThree: However, we cannot guarantee that loss, misuse, unauthorised acquisition, or alteration of your data will not occur. Please recognise that you play a vital role in protecting your own personal information. When registering with our Services, it is important to choose a password of sufficient length and complexity, to not reveal this password to any third-parties, and to immediately notify us if you become aware of any unauthorised access to or use of your account.
privacyParagraphFortyFour: Furthermore, we cannot ensure or warrant the security or confidentiality of information you transmit to us or receive from us by Internet or wireless connection, including email, phone, or SMS, since we have no way of protecting that information once it leaves and until it reaches us. If you have reason to believe that your data is no longer secure, please contact us via support.
privacyParagraphFortyFive: HOW YOU CAN ACCESS OR CHANGE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION
privacyParagraphFortySix: You are entitled to review, correct, or amend your personal information, or to delete that information where it is inaccurate. You may do this at any time by contacting support.
privacyParagraphFortySeven: If you close your Flitaa account, we will mark your account in our database as 'Closed', but will keep your account information in our database for the period of time described below. This is necessary in order to deter fraud by ensuring that people who try to commit fraud will not be able to avoid detection simply by closing their account and opening a new one. However, if you close your account, your personal information will not be used by us for any further purposes, nor sold or shared with third parties, except as necessary to prevent fraud and assist law enforcement, as required by law, or in accordance with this Privacy Policy.
privacyParagraphFortyEight: RIGHTS IN RELATION TO USE OF YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION
privacyParagraphFortyNine: Rights of access, correction and deletion. You have a right of access to the personal information that we hold about you under relevant data protection legislation, and to some related information. You can also require any inaccurate personal information to be corrected or deleted.
privacyParagraphFiftyOne: We store your personal information securely throughout the life of your Flitaa account and for as long as the law requires and as necessary to fulfil the purposes for which we collected it, including for the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, or reporting obligations or to resolve disputes. While retention requirements vary by jurisdiction, information about our typical retention periods for different aspects of your personal information is described below.
privacyParagraphFiftyTwo: a. Contact information such as your name, email address and telephone number for marketing purposes is retained on an ongoing basis until you un-subscribe. Thereafter, we will add your details to our suppression list indefinitely.
privacyParagraphFiftyThree: b. Content that you post on our website, such as support desk comments, photographs, videos, blog posts, and other content, may be kept indefinitely after you close your account for audit and crime prevention purposes.
privacyParagraphFiftyFour: c. Recording of our telephone calls with you may be kept for a period of up to six years.Information collected via technical means such as cookies, webpage counters and other analytics tools is kept for a period of up to one year from the expiration of the cookie.
privacyParagraphFiftySix: We do not knowingly request to collect personal information from any person under the age of 18. If a user submitting personal information is suspected of being younger than 18 years of age, Flitaa will require the user to close his or her account and will not allow the user to continue transacting digital currencies using Flitaa. We will also take steps to delete the information as soon as possible. Please notify us if you know of any individuals under the age of 18 using our Services so we can take action to prevent access to them.
privacyParagraphFiftyEight: The personal data we collect may be transferred to, stored and processed outside of the jurisdiction in which you reside, and the laws of those countries may differ from the laws applicable in your own country. Any processing of such data will be undertaken by our staff, or the staff of our third-party service providers, whose roles will include verifying your identity, processing payment details, and providing customer support.
privacyParagraphFiftyNine: By accepting this Privacy Policy, and then submitting your personal data, you agree to the transfer, storing or processing of it outside of your jurisdiction.
privacyParagraphSixty: If you have any questions, clarifications, concerns, or request, kindly reach out to us via support@flitaa.com
theseFlitaa: These Flitaa Terms & Conditions  of Use (“Terms”) are entered into between you (hereinafter referred to as “you” or “your”) and Flitaa (as defined below). By accessing, downloading, using or clicking on “I agree” to accept any Flitaa Services (as defined below) provided by Flitaa (as defined below), you agree that you have read, understood and accepted all of the terms and conditions stipulated in these Terms (hereinafter referred to as “these Terms”) as well as our Privacy Policy at https://www.Flitaa.com/privacy. In addition, when using some features of the Services, you may be subject to specific additional terms and conditions applicable to those features.
pleaseReadTheTermsCarefully: Please read the terms carefully, as they govern your use of Flitaa Services. THESE TERMS CONTAIN IMPORTANT PROVISIONS, INCLUDING AN ARBITRATION PROVISION THAT REQUIRES ALL CLAIMS TO BE RESOLVED BY WAY OF LEGALLY BINDING ARBITRATION. The terms of the arbitration provision are as set forth hereunder, “CUSTOMER FEEDBACK, QUERIES, COMPLAINTS, AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION”. As with any asset, the values of Digital Currencies (as defined below) may fluctuate significantly, and there is a substantial risk of economic losses when purchasing, selling, holding, or investing in Digital Currencies and their derivatives. BY MAKING USE OF Flitaa SERVICES, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT: (1) YOU ARE AWARE OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH TRANSACTIONS OF DIGITAL CURRENCIES AND THEIR DERIVATIVES; (2) YOU SHALL ASSUME ALL RISKS RELATED TO THE USE OF Flitaa SERVICES AND TRANSACTIONS OF DIGITAL CURRENCIES AND THEIR DERIVATIVES; AND (3) Flitaa SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY SUCH RISKS OR ADVERSE OUTCOMES.
flitaaIsNotResponsibleFor: Flitaa is not responsible for, and expressly disclaims all liability for, damages of any kind arising out of use, reference to, or reliance on any information contained within Flitaa platforms. While the information contained within the platforms is periodically updated, no guarantee is given that the information provided on this Web site is correct, complete, and up-to-date. Although the Flitaa website may include links providing direct access to other Internet resources, including websites, Flitaa is not responsible for the accuracy or content of the information contained in these websites. Links from Flitaa platforms to third-party sites do not constitute an endorsement by Flitaa of the parties or their products and services. The appearance on the Flitaa website of advertisements and product or service information does not constitute an endorsement by Flitaa, and Flitaa does not investigate any claim made by any advertiser. Product information is based solely on material received from suppliers.
byAccessingUsingOrAttempting: By accessing, using, or attempting to use Flitaa Services in any capacity, you acknowledge that you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree, do not access Flitaa or utilise Flitaa services.
flitaaIsADiversePlatform: Flitaa is a diverse platform comprising Flitaa websites (whose domain names include but are not limited to (https://www.Flitaa.com), mobile applications, clients, applets and other applications that are developed to offer Flitaa Services, and includes independently-operated platforms, websites and clients within our ecosystem (e.g Flitaa Hub, Flitaa Academy, Flitaa NFT marketplace, Flitaa CEX App and fiat gateways). (Collectively referred to as “Platforms”) In case of any inconsistency between the relevant terms of use of the above platforms and the contents of these Terms, the respective applicable terms of such platforms shall prevail.
flitaaOperatorsReferToAllParties: Flitaa operators refer to all parties that run Flitaa, including, but not limited to, legal persons, unincorporated organisations, and teams that provide Flitaa Services and are responsible for such services. For convenience, unless otherwise stated, references to “Flitta” and “we” in these Terms specifically mean Flitaa Operators. UNDER THESE TERMS, Flitaa OPERATORS MAY CHANGE AS Flitaa'S BUSINESS ADJUSTS, IN WHICH CASE THE CHANGED OPERATORS SHALL PERFORM THEIR OBLIGATIONS UNDER THESE TERMS WITH YOU AND PROVIDE SERVICES TO YOU, AND SUCH CHANGE DOES NOT AFFECT YOUR RIGHTS AND INTERESTS UNDER THESE TERMS. ADDITIONALLY, THE SCOPE OF Flitaa OPERATORS MAY BE EXPANDED DUE TO THE PROVISION OF NEW Flitaa SERVICES, IN WHICH CASE, IF YOU CONTINUE TO USE Flitaa SERVICES, IT IS DEEMED THAT YOU HAVE AGREED TO JOINTLY EXECUTE THESE TERMS WITH THE NEWLY ADDED Flitaa OPERATORS. IN CASE OF A DISPUTE, YOU SHALL DETERMINE THE ENTITIES BY WHICH THESE TERMS ARE PERFORMED WITH YOU AND THE COUNTERPARTIES OF THE DISPUTE, DEPENDING ON THE SPECIFIC SERVICES YOU USE AND THE PARTICULAR ACTIONS THAT AFFECT YOUR RIGHTS OR INTERESTS.
flitaaServicesReferToVariousServices: Flitaa services refer to various services provided to you by Flitaa that are based on Internet and/or blockchain technologies and offered via Flitaa websites, mobile applications, APIs, clients, and other forms (including new ones enabled by future technological development). Flitaa Services include, but are not limited to, such Flitaa Platform components as Digital Asset Trading Platforms, Flitaa Hub, Flitaa Academy, Flitaa App, and Fiat Gateway, as well as novel services to be provided by Flitaa.
flitaaPlatformRulesReferToAllRules: Flitaa platform rules refer to all rules, interpretations, announcements, statements, letters of consent and other contents that have been and will be subsequently released by Flitaa, as well as all regulations, implementation rules, product process descriptions, and announcements as published by Flitaa or within the products or service processes.
digitalCurrenciesReferToEncryptedOrDigit: Digital currencies refer to encrypted or digital tokens or cryptocurrencies with a certain value that are based on blockchain and cryptography technologies and are issued and managed in a decentralised form.
digitalAssetsReferToDigitalCurrencies: Digital Assets refer to Digital Currencies, their derivatives, or other types of digitalized assets with a certain value.
flitaaAccountsReferToTheFoundationalVirt: Flitaa Accounts refer to the foundational virtual accounts, including main accounts and subaccounts, which are opened by Flitaa for users to record on Flitaa their usage of Flitaa Services, transactions, asset changes, and basic information. Flitaa Accounts serve as the basis for users to enjoy and exercise their rights on Flitaa. This may be used interchangeably with Flitaa Wallet and Flitaa Wallet accounts.
CryptoToCryptoTradingRefersToSpotTransac: Crypto to Crypto Trading refers to spot transactions in which one digital currency is exchanged for another digital currency.
FiatToFiatTradingRefersToSpotTransaction: Fiat to Fiat Trading refers to spot transactions in which Digital Currencies are exchanged for fiat currencies or vice versa.
theseTermsConstituteALegalAgreement: These Terms constitute a legal agreement and create a binding contract between you and Flitaa Operators.
dueToTheRapidDevelopmentOfDigitalCurrenc: Due to the rapid development of Digital Currencies and Flitaa, these Terms do not enumerate or cover all rights and obligations of each party and do not guarantee full alignment with needs arising from future development. Therefore, THE PRIVACY POLICY, Flitaa PLATFORM RULES, AND ALL OTHER AGREEMENTS ENTERED INTO SEPARATELY BETWEEN YOU AND Flitaa ARE DEEMED SUPPLEMENTARY TERMS THAT ARE AN INTEGRAL PART OF THESE TERMS AND SHALL HAVE THE SAME LEGAL EFFECT. YOUR USE OF Flitaa SERVICES IS DEEMED YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE ABOVE SUPPLEMENTARY TERMS.
flitaaReservesTheRightToChangeOrModify: Flitaa reserves the right to change or modify these Terms at its discretion, modifying the last revised date displayed on this page. ANY AND ALL MODIFICATIONS OR CHANGES TO THESE TERMS WILL BE EFFECTIVE UPON PUBLICATION ON THE WEBSITE OR RELEASE TO USERS. THEREFORE, YOUR CONTINUED USE OF Flitaa SERVICES IS DEEMED YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE MODIFIED TERMS AND RULES. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO ANY CHANGES TO THESE TERMS, YOU MUST STOP USING Flitaa SERVICES IMMEDIATELY. YOU ARE RECOMMENDED TO FREQUENTLY REVIEW THESE TERMS TO ENSURE YOUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS THAT APPLY TO YOUR ACCESS TO AND USE OF Flitaa SERVICES.
allUsersMustApplyForAFlitaaAccount: All Users must apply for a Flitaa Account at https://app.Flitaa.com/register before using Flitaa Services. When you register a Flitaa Account, you must provide the information requested by Flitaa and accept these Terms, the Privacy Policy, and other supplementary provisions. Flitaa reserves the right to accept or decline an Account registration. You agree to provide complete and accurate information when opening a Flitaa Account, and you agree to timely update any information you provide to Flitaa to maintain the integrity and accuracy of the information. Each user (including a natural person, business, or legal entity) may maintain only one main account at any given time. Flitaa reserves the right to consent or not consent to the opening of more than one Flitaa Account per user and shall not be liable for any issues arising as a result of a user opening multiple Flitaa Accounts.
byRegisteringToUseAFlitaaAccount: By registering to use a Flitaa Account, you represent and warrant that (i) as an individual, you are at least 18 or are of legal age to form a binding contract under applicable laws; (ii) as an individual, legal person, or other organization, you have full legal capacity and sufficient authorizations to enter into these Terms; (iii) you have not been previously suspended or removed from using Flitaa Services; (iv) you do not currently have a Flitaa Account; (v) If you act as an employee or agent of a legal entity, and enter into these Terms on their behalf, you represent and warrant that you have all the necessary rights and authorizations to bind such legal entity; (vi) your use of Flitaa Services will not violate any and all laws and regulations applicable to you, including but not limited to regulations on anti-money laundering, anti-corruption, and counter-terrorist financing.
IfAsAParentOrGuardian: If, as a parent or guardian, you become aware that your child or ward child has provided us with any information without your consent, please contact us through the details on the Privacy Policy.
pleaseNoteThatSomeProductsAndServices: Please note that some products and services may not be available in certain jurisdictions, regions, or to certain users. Your eligibility to access certain Flitaa Services also depends on the country in which you reside and the countries that Flitaa operates in (“Operating Country”) and holds bank accounts in that country. Flitaa reserves the right to change, modify, or impose additional restrictions at its discretion at any time.
yourRegistrationOfAFlitaaAccountWillBeDe: Your registration of a Flitaa account will be deemed your agreement to provide the required personal information for identity verification. Such information will be used to verify users' identities, identify traces of money laundering, terrorist financing, fraud, and other financial crimes through Flitaa, or for other lawful purposes stated by Flitaa. We will collect, use, and share such information in accordance with our Privacy Policy. In addition to providing such information, you agree to allow us to keep a record of that information during the period for which your account is active and within six (6) years after your account is closed, in compliance with global industry standards on data storage. You also authorise us to conduct necessary investigations directly or through a third party to verify your identity or protect you and/or us from financial crimes, such as fraud. The information we require to verify your identity may include, but is not limited to, your name, email address, contact information, phone number, username, government-issued ID, date of birth, taxpayer identification number, information regarding your bank account (such as bank name, account type, routing number, and account number), and other information collected during account registration. When providing the required information, you confirm it is true and accurate.
afterRegistrationYouMustEnsureThatTheInf: After registration, you must ensure that the information provided is true, complete, and timely updated when changed. If there are any grounds for believing that any of the information you provided is incorrect, false, outdated or incomplete, Flitaa reserves the right to send you a notice to demand correction, directly delete the relevant information, or, as the case may be, terminate all or part of the Flitaa services we provide for you. If we are unable to reach you with the contact information you provided, you shall be fully liable for any loss or expense caused to Flitaa during your use of Flitaa services. You hereby acknowledge and agree that you have the obligation to update all the information if there is any change. By registering an account, you hereby authorise Flitaa to conduct investigations that Flitaa considers necessary, either directly or through a third party, to verify your identity or protect you, other users, and/or Flitaa from fraud or other financial crimes, and to take necessary actions based on the results of such investigations. You also acknowledge and agree that your personal information may be disclosed to credit bureaus and agencies for fraud prevention or financial crime prevention, which may respond to our investigations in full.
additionallyWeMayRequireYouToWait: Additionally, we may require you to wait some amount of time after the completion of a transaction before permitting you to use further Flitaa Services and/or before permitting you to engage in transactions beyond certain volume limits. This includes authorising your wireless operator (MTN Nigeria, Globacom, 9Mobile, Airtel or any other branded wireless operator) to use your mobile number, name, address, email, network status, customer type, customer role, billing type, mobile device identifiers (IMSI and IMEI), and other subscriber status details, if available, solely to allow verification of your identity and to compare information you have provided to Flitaa with your wireless operator account profile information for the duration of the business relationship.
youHerebyAgreeToAbstainFromTransmitting: You hereby agree to abstain from transmitting any content of an obscene, indecent or inappropriate nature during the verification process. Non-compliance with this clause may entail your potential liability under the Cybercrimes (Prevention and Prohibition) Act of 2015. Your cooperation in upholding this standard of conduct is greatly appreciated.
duringTheSignUpProcess: During the sign-up process, you are required to provide your legal name as it appears on official identification documents. Aliases, nicknames, or any other non-legal names shall not be accepted for registration. This requirement ensures the accuracy and authenticity of your information on the Platform. We reserve the right to verify the provided information and may take appropriate action in cases of non-compliance.
toAccessTheFlitaaServicesYouMust: To access the Flitaa Services, you must have the necessary equipment (such as a smartphone, tablet, or computer) and the associated telecommunication service subscriptions to access the Internet. The Flitaa Services can be accessed directly using the Flitaa websites (whose domain names include but are not limited to https://www.Flitaa.com, mobile applications, clients, applets and other applications that are developed to offer Flitaa Services, and includes independently-operated platforms, websites and clients within our ecosystem (e.g Flitaa Hub, Flitaa Academy, Flitaa NFT market, Flitaa CEX App and fiat gateways).
theFlitaaAccountCanOnlyBeUsedByTheAccoun: The Flitaa Account can only be used by the account registrant. Flitaa reserves the right to suspend, restrict/freeze, block or cancel the use of Flitaa Accounts by persons other than the account registrant. If you suspect or become aware of any unauthorised use of your username and password, you should notify Flitaa immediately. Flitaa assumes no liability for any loss or damage arising from the use of the Flitaa Account by you or any third party, with or without your authorization.
FlitaaHasBeenCommittedToMaintainingTheSe: Flitaa has been committed to maintaining the security of User entrusted funds and has implemented industry standard protection for Flitaa Services. However, the actions of individual Users may pose risks. You shall agree to treat your access credentials (such as username, password, pin and 2FA security key) as confidential information and not to disclose such information to any third party. You also agree to be solely responsible for taking the necessary security measures to protect your Flitaa Account and personal information.
youShouldBeSolelyResponsibleForTheSafety: You should be solely responsible for the safety of your Flitaa Account and password, and you should be responsible for all the transactions in your Flitaa Account. Flitaa assumes no liability for any loss or consequences caused by authorised or unauthorised use of your account credentials, including but not limited to information disclosure, information release, consent or submission of various rules and agreements by clicking on the website, online agreement renewal, etc.
byCreatingAFlitaaAccountYouHerebyAgreeTh: BY CREATING A FLITAA ACCOUNT, YOU HEREBY AGREE THAT:
youWillNotifyFlitaaImmediately: i. you will notify Flitaa immediately if you are aware of any unauthorised use of your Flitaa Account and password or any other violation of security rules;
youWillStrictlyAbideByAllMechanisms: ii. you will strictly abide by all mechanisms or procedures of Flitaa regarding security, authentication, trading, charging, and withdrawal; and
youWillTakeAppropriateSteps: iii. you will take appropriate steps to log out of Flitaa at the end of each visit to the platform.
uponCompletionOfTheRegistration: Upon completion of the registration and identity verification for your Flitaa Account, you may use various Flitaa Services, including but not limited to Crypto-to-crypto Trading, Fiat Trading, Flitaa Savings services, other information released by Flitaa, participating in User activities held by Flitaa, etc., in accordance with the provisions of these Terms (including Flitaa Platform Rules and other individual agreements). Flitaa has the right to:
provideModifyOrTerminate: i. Provide, modify or terminate, in its discretion, any Flitaa Services based on its development plan; and

yourDigitalCurrencyWallet: Your Digital Currency wallet enables you to send, request, receive and store Digital Currency from third parties by giving instructions through the Flitaa site (each such transaction is a “Digital Currency Transaction”).
allDigitalCurrencyTransactionsAreProcess: All Digital Currency transactions are processed as per your instructions. You agree that all information regarding instructions submitted is verified by you. We do not guarantee the identity of any user, receiver, requestee or other party.
digitalCurrencyTransactionsCannotBeRever: Digital Currency Transactions cannot be reversed once broadcast to the relevant digital currency network. Once submitted to a Digital Currency network, a Digital Currency Transaction will be unconfirmed for a period of time pending sufficient confirmation of the transaction by the Digital Currency network. A Digital Currency Transaction is not complete while it is in a pending state. Digital Currency associated with Digital Currency Transactions that are in a pending state will be designated accordingly and will not be included in your Digital Currency Wallet balance or be available to conduct digital currency transactions.
weMayChargeNetworkFees: We may charge network fees (miner fees) to process a Digital Currency Transaction on your behalf. We will calculate the network fee at its discretion, although we will always notify you of the network fee at or before the time of authorization of the Transaction.
weMayRefuseToProcess: We may refuse to process or cancel any pending Digital Currency Transaction as required by law, any court, or any other authority to which Flitaa is subject in any jurisdiction.
youHerebyAgreeThatFlitaa: You hereby agree that Flitaa reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to delist any digital currency/asset from its offerings without incurring any liability whatsoever towards you. Flitaa will provide notice to you in a timely manner regarding any such delisting, and you are encouraged to take appropriate action regarding their holdings of the affected digital asset. Flitaa shall not be held responsible for any losses or damages incurred by you as a result of the delisting of a digital currency.
